column4: Anybody can tell me why when I click "burn" in k3b, the only option in the resulting dialog is to "Only Create Image"? I don't want to only create the image, I want to burn the image to the DVD.
not sure what you mean, but yeah, a dvd image is an iso file

no, i've got a bunch of files that I want k3b to burn to a data dvd, but "only create image" sounds like its going to stop before the image gets burned to dvd.  I don't just want an iso.  I want the iso on the dvd.
it is a tool made for the purpose of upgrading in Ubuntu, they intend to increase its checkas.
they don't have a command line interface to it?
well, that is just what I got out of the https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MeetingLogs/OpenWeek_AskMark search for "<pointwood>" in that page
I still do not believe any of it, since I know little about it still.
supposedly it will check for changes done by things such as automatix, and so on.
ask google, it has a link.
the thing is that I could have went to google, and typed in automatix and gave you some links, or referred you to my source, I think the latter is the right choice.
If you don't know what automatix is, you could have also just said I don't know?
I do have some kind of idea what it is, but think their official site and the collective web have more knowledge.
what about eth1 ath0 wlan0 or something like that?
ummm, you would just start trying that stuff randomly, or there is way to look up what it is?
